choices.D: Set the authorize.conf setting: srchJobsQuota to no value.
choices.A: Set the authorize.conf setting: srchIndexesDefault to no value.
choices.C: Set the authorize.conf setting: srchIndexesAllowed to no value.
choices.B: Set the authorize.conf setting: srchFilter to no value.

discussion.content:
Should be A 
https://community.splunk.com/t5/Archive/srchIndexesDefault-parameter-is-not-respected-when-srchFilter-is/m-p/495869
The B option only limits what indexes they search by default
The correct answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
Correct is A, if you dont give default indexes
A is the correct

Selected Answer: A
I think that the answer is "A"

questions.question_text: How could a role in which all users must specify an index=clause in all searches be configured?

choices.B: To ensure every customer has exactly the same base settings.

choices.D: To provide settings that can be customized to meet customer requirements.

discussion.content:

each customer has different requirements and doing base configurations depends on them. So D
I think D
D is the one

I think that the answer is "D"

questions.question_text:
Data can be onboarded using apps, Splunk Web, or the CLI.
Which is the PS preferred method?

choices.A: Create UDP input port 9997 on a UF.
choices.B: Use the add data wizard in Splunk Web.
choices.D: Use a scripted input to monitor a log file.

discussion.content: PS recommends C

wrong the Data Wizard is for trialing small sets of data <500MB of log files 
The proper method is to use inputs.conf in combination with small single use Splunk apps for the data source.

Selected Answer: C
C is the recommended way for Splunk PS

Selected Answer: C
ALWAYS USE INPUTS! C
C looks fine
Agree that it should be C.
Should be C. PS recommends base configs apps

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements applies to indexer discovery?

choices.B: Forwarders can automatically discover new indexers added to the cluster.
choices.D: Search heads can automatically discover new indexers added to the cluster.
choices.A: The Cluster Master (CM) can automatically discover new indexers added to the cluster.
choices.C: Deployment servers can automatically configure new indexers added to the cluster.

discussion.content: B is the answer

Selected Answer: B
B (https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.2.0/Indexer/indexerdiscovery) and btw not D as the SH will use the Cluster Leader to detect available peers
B is the correct one.

Selected Answer: B
its B.

Selected Answer: B
B is thew one
B is OK
The correct answer is B

B 
more info 

Briefly, the process works like this:

1. The peer nodes provide the manager node with information on their receiving ports.

2. The forwarders poll the manager at regular intervals for the list of available peer nodes.

The answer is B.
Reference: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.1.1/Indexer/indexerdiscovery
